comments:
Build ID: M20060629-1905

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Select java project ( eclipse plugin).
2. Right click. Select 'Run as' --> Eclipse application.
3. From a list I select my eclipse plugin.
4. Get message "Could not start application".


More information:

can you attach the dev.properties file, and see wha happens when you don't have a directory with 3.2 in the path?

(In reply to comment #1)
> can you attach the dev.properties file, and see wha happens when you don't have
> a directory with 3.2 in the path?


Hi,

Sorry was to tired yesterday to follow along. This is the content of dev.properties:

#
#Wed Aug 15 07:43:15 CEST 2007
net.sourceforge.eclipseccase=bin
net.sourceforge.eclipseccase.ui=bin
@ignoredot@=true


I cannot change the path since I don't have the permisson on sys/3.2 directory.

cheers,

//mikael

Please add "-console -noExit" to the program arguments on the "Arguments" tab when you launch.

You should get an osgi> prompt.  At the prompt run the "props" command and post the results here.  I'm most interested in what the value of osgi.bundles property is.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Please add "-console -noExit" to the program arguments on the "Arguments" tab
> when you launch.
> 
> You should get an osgi> prompt.  At the prompt run the "props" command and post
> the results here.  I'm most interested in what the value of osgi.bundles
> property is.
>

Mikael, you say it works for you on 3.3 without a NumberFormatException?  The properties listed in comment 5 look like they are from a 3.3 launch.  Can you get the properties from a failed launch where you see the NumberFormatException?  Thanks.
